riddles.title: Bear Thief
riddles.riddle: I left my campsite and hiked south for 3 miles. Then I turned east and hiked for 3 miles. I then turned north and hiked for 3 miles, at which time I came upon a bear inside my tent eating my food! What color was the bear?

riddles.title: Not Twins?
riddles.riddle: Two boys are born to the same molther on the same day at the same time in the same month and year and yet they're not twins. How?

riddles.title: A Real Place?
riddles.riddle: What has cities, but not houses; forests, but not trees; and rivers, but no water?

riddles.title: Colorful Houses
riddles.riddle: A red house is made from red bricks. A blue house is made from blue bricks. A yellow house is made from yellow bricks. What is a green house made from?

riddles.title: Animal Frankenstien
riddles.riddle: What is 3/7 chicken, 2/3 cat, and 2/4 goat?

riddles.title: Cheap Book
riddles.riddle: A book costs $1 plus half its price. How much does it cost?

riddles.title: Big Family
riddles.riddle: Your parents have six sons including you, and each son has one sister. How many people are in the family?

riddles.title: Waterproof Man
riddles.riddle: A man was walking in the rain. He had no umbrella, no hat, and his clothes were soaked. Yet not a single hair on his head got wet. How could this happen?

riddles.title: Birthday Riddle
riddles.riddle: The day before yesterday I was 21, and next year I will be 24. When is my birthday?

riddles.title: Don't Steal
riddles.riddle: The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?

riddles.title: Highest Mountain
riddles.riddle: Before Mount Everest was discovered, what was the highest mountain on Earth?

riddles.title: Time Travel?
riddles.riddle: A man rode out of town on Sunday, he stayed a whole night at a hotel and rode back to town the next day on Sunday. How is this possible?

riddles.title: Reverse Riddle
riddles.riddle: Forward I am heavy, but backward I am not. What am I?

riddles.title: Timepiece
riddles.riddle: A sundial has the fewest moving parts of any timepiece. Which has the most?

riddles.title: Expensive Hotel
riddles.riddle: A man pushes his car until he reaches a hotel. Upon reaching the hotel, he is bankrupt. What happened?

riddles.title: Extremely Alive
riddles.riddle: I have 13 hearts, but no other organs. What am I?

riddles.title: Family Lineage
riddles.riddle: Two father and two sons are in a car, yet there are only three people in the car. How?
riddles.answer: It was a grandfather, his son, and his grandson

riddles.title: Buried Alive
riddles.riddle: You bury me when I am alive, and dig me up when I die. What am I?

riddles.title: Cake Cutter
riddles.riddle: You have a birthday cake and have exactly 3 slices to cut it into 8 equal pieces. How do you do it?
riddles.answer: Cut from the top in 4 equal pieces, then cut the cake in half horizontally

riddles.title: Rearrange Riddle
riddles.riddle: What common English verb becomes its own past tense by rearranging its letters?

riddles.title: Well Traveled
riddles.riddle: What goes around the world but stays in a corner?

riddles.title: Give and Take
riddles.riddle: What gets bigger the more you take away from it?

riddles.title: House Riddle
riddles.riddle: You live in a one story house made entirely of redwood. What color would the stairs be?
riddles.answer: There are no stairs in a one story house

riddles.title: Only Up
riddles.riddle: What goes up but never comes down?

riddles.title: Broken and Useful
riddles.riddle: What is more useful when it is broken?

riddles.title: Old and Young
riddles.riddle: I am tall when I am young, and I am short when I am old. What am I?

riddles.title: Duck, Duck, more Duck
riddles.riddle: There are two ducks in front of a duck, two ducks behind a duck, and a duck in the middle. How many ducks are there?

riddles.title: Dirty and Clean
riddles.riddle: I am white when I am dirty, and black when I am clean. What am I?

riddles.title: Three Two One
riddles.riddle: If you have three, you have three. If you have two, you have two. But if you have one, you have none. What am I?

riddles.title: Yours
riddles.riddle: What belongs to you, but other people use it more than you?

riddles.title: Shorter Riddle
riddles.riddle: What becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?

riddles.title: One Minute Riddle
riddles.riddle: What comes once in a minute and twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?

riddles.title: Broken Riddle
riddles.riddle: What gets harder to break the more it is broken?

riddles.title: 4 Letter Riddle
riddles.riddle: What 4 letter word is the same written forwards, backwards and upside down?

riddles.title: Big Riddle
riddles.riddle: What is as big as an elephant, but weighs nothing at all?

riddles.title: Feed the Beast
riddles.riddle: Feed me and I live, yet give me a drink and I die. What am I?
